overview:
Cole Sirucek is an entrepreneur and investor. Currently, he is the Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Epic MMA Club, Asia largest mixed martial arts training club. He is also a Co-Founder and Executive Chairman of DocDoc Pte. Ltd., Asia’s largest real-time online doctor reservation system and is a member of the Board of Directors for Global Eagle Acquisition Corp, a NASDAQ listed Special Purpose Acquisition Corporation focused on the media and entertainment industry.

Previously, Cole spent seven years as an investor with Temasek Holdings. In this capacity, he sourced, executed and monitored investments on a global basis in the firm’s telecommunications, media and technology group. He has successfully invested US$506M.

Before Temasek, he was the Co-Founder and Executive Vice President of Pluto Networks – a wireless data networking company. He has previously held executive positions in Hawaii’s State Government and has worked as a technology venture capitalist and strategy business consultant.

Cole grew up in the USA and attended Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Sloan School (Master of Business Administration) and Harvard’s Kennedy School of Government (Masters of Public Administration). He was a President of MIT’s Private Equity & Venture Capital Association and a Lead Organizer of the MIT $100K Global Startup Workshop Entrepreneurship Competition.

In his free time, Cole is a martial artist, adventure racer, scuba diver and mountaineer. Cole has completed self-supported 250KM foot races across China’s Gobi Desert and Egypt’s Sahara Desert, funding medical missions in Vietnam and China that directly saved the lives +13 children. He has also successfully led an expedition up the Western Breach of Mt. Kilimanjaro, for the Make-A-Wish Foundation of Singapore.
